intro: Satyria allenii, commonly known as the Allen's satyria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the United States. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has hairy stems and oval-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
